author: spencer_tb
content: Yeah this is correct! Just increased to be safer rather than sorry as we don't have benchmarks!

author: draganrakita
content: This does not make a lot of sense, every bitwise operation is 3gas. Where did this concert come from? As Pawel said 5 is big overshoot

author: spencer_tb
content: I don't disagree it's definitely on the conservative side - we wanted benchmarks (I don't like to trust assumptions) but opted for 5 to freeze Fusaka faster, knowing we can reprice in Glamsterdam (discussed on ACDT 2 weeks ago)

author: draganrakita
content:
Okay here it is. Context: it pushes N values and executed opcode 50 times (Bytecodes are [here](https://github.com/bluealloy/revm/blob/main/bins/revme/src/cmd/bench/gas_cost_estimator_sample.csv)):
[LT: 1.2us](https://codspeed.io/bluealloy/revm/benchmarks/bins/revme/benches/evm.rs::benches::evm::LT_50?runnerMode=Instrumentation) 
[EQ: 1.1us](https://codspeed.io/bluealloy/revm/benchmarks/bins/revme/benches/evm.rs::benches::evm::EQ_50?runnerMode=Instrumentation)
[ISZERO: 0.8us](https://codspeed.io/bluealloy/revm/benchmarks/bins/revme/benches/evm.rs::benches::evm::ISZERO_50?runnerMode=Instrumentation)
[CLZ: 0.2us](https://codspeed.io/bluealloy/revm/benchmarks/bins/revme/benches/evm.rs::benches::evm::CLZ_50?branchId=687e1aeb78882d2064a4ed11)
[MUL: 1.8us](https://codspeed.io/bluealloy/revm/benchmarks/bins/revme/benches/evm.rs::benches::evm::MUL_50?runnerMode=Instrumentation)
